parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An accuser, prosecutor. From kata and agora; against one in the assembly, i.e. A complainant at law; specially, Satan.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A verbal defense (particularly in a law court). From the same as apologeomai; a plea.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An accusation, charge. From egkaleo; an accusation, i.e. Offence alleged.
